wikipedia_page.main: Frances Helen Melville (11 October 1873 – 7 March 1962), was a suffragist, advocate for higher education for women in Scotland, and one of the first women to matriculate at the University of Edinburgh in 1892. She was president of the British Federation of University Women from 1935 to 1942.

response: * Frances Melville (1873–1962) –  suffragist, advocate for higher education for women in Scotland, and one of the first women to matriculate at the University of Edinburgh
